sign

public int sign(byte[] outbuf,
                int offset,
                int length)
         throws SignatureException
Description copied from class: Signature
Generates the signature of all/last input data. A call to this method also resets this signature object to the state it was in when previously initialized via a call to initSign() and the message to sign given via a call to update(). That is, the object is reset and available to sign another message.

Warning: This method is not part of the Security and Trust Services API (SATSA) 1.0 specification.

Specified by:
sign in class Signature
Parameters:
outbuf - the output buffer to store signature data
offset - starting offset within the output buffer at which to begin signature data
length - max byte to write to the buffer
Returns:
number of bytes of signature output in sigBuf
Throws:
SignatureException - if this signature object is not initialized properly, or len is less than the actual signature

update

public void update(byte[] inBuff,
                   int inOffset,
                   int inLength)
Description copied from class: Signature
Updates the data to be verified or signed, using the specified array of bytes, starting at the specified offset.

Specified by:
update in class Signature
Parameters:
inBuff - the array of bytes.
inOffset - the offset to start from in the array of bytes.
inLength - the number of bytes to use, starting at offset.

verify

public boolean verify(byte[] outbuf,
                      int offset,
                      int length)
               throws SignatureException
Description copied from class: Signature
Verifies the passed-in signature.

Warning: This method is not part of the Security and Trust Services API (SATSA) 1.0 specification.

A call to this method resets this signature object to the state it was in when previously initialized for verification via a call to initVerify(PublicKey). That is, the object is reset and available to verify another signature from the identity whose public key was specified in the call to initVerify.

Specified by:
verify in class Signature
Parameters:
outbuf - the input buffer containing signature data
offset - starting offset within the signature where signature data begins
length - byte length of signature data
Returns:
true if signature verifies, false if not.
Throws:
SignatureException - if this signature object is not initialized properly, or the passed-in signature is improperly encoded or of the wrong type, etc.

initSign

public void initSign(PrivateKey theKey)
              throws InvalidKeyException
Description copied from class: Signature
Initializes the Signature object with the appropriate Key for signature creation.

Warning: This method is not part of the Security and Trust Services API (SATSA) 1.0 specification.

Specified by:
initSign in class Signature
Parameters:
theKey - the key object to use for signing
Throws:
InvalidKeyException - if the key type is inconsistent with the mode or signature implementation.

initVerify

public void initVerify(PublicKey theKey)
                throws InvalidKeyException
Description copied from class: Signature
Initializes this object for verification. If this method is called again with a different argument, it negates the effect of this call.

Specified by:
initVerify in class Signature
Parameters:
theKey - the public key of the identity whose signature is going to be verified.
Throws:
InvalidKeyException - if the key is invalid.
